attributes.action: No transfer of powers to councils to fine motorists for minor traffic offences
attributes.background: Town halls want to rake in more cash by securing sweeping new powers to impose fines on motorists for minor traffic offences.  The Local Government Association want government to transfer powers to them that are currently only available to the police.
attributes.additional_details: The Local Government Association have already started the process of lobbying government in the form of the Department of Transport.  They believe that they are better suited to this enforcement than the police.  This has already been rejected once, but they are continuing to put pressure on government for the change.  We already know that local government isn't about making things safer it's purely a revenue raising exercise and again the motorist is yet again being seen as a cash cow.

attributes.action: Ban credit checks for job applications
attributes.background: Most jobs now require credit checks. All of us have a past - should we be judged on our credit? does it affect our ability to work?
attributes.additional_details: The majority of people have at least one debt or more, especially trying to survive on benefits.

attributes.action: Make driving tests graded to reduce premiums for safer new drivers
attributes.background: Insurance premiums continue to rise for new drivers, as all new drivers are classed as a high risk to the road. By having a grading system in place in the practical driving exam, then the examiner will be able to judge the driver's safety. This may allow a reduction in premiums for safer drivers.

attributes.action: Free residential or nursing care for everyone who fought during WW 2.
attributes.background: People who risked their lives for our country are now forced to give up everything to pay for their care.

attributes.action: Ban gas stunning of animals
attributes.background: Gas stunning is a cruel method of killing animals. A video on YouTube made me aware of this horrid way animals are killed everyday. It should be made illegal.

attributes.action: Name one Dreadnought class submarine "HMS Thunder Child"
attributes.background: One of the new Dreadnought class submarines should be named "HMS Thunder Child" in honour of H.G. Wells' hero ship from War of the Worlds. This would infuse a sense of identity and culture being influenced by the famous literature of our nation.
attributes.additional_details: HMS Thunder Child is the fictional ironclad warship that destroys two Martian tripods in HG Wells' War of the Worlds before being sunk by a heat ray from a third tripod.

attributes.action: Make sadism a criminal offence
attributes.background:
This petition asks the government to create a new criminal offence called
 'Causing suffering for a sadistic cause'.
The act will cover all cases in which somebody deliberately physically or mentally harms a person in an unprovoked attack and then gets pleasure from their reaction/ suffering.
attributes.additional_details:
The crime will have a maximum sentence of 5 years imprisonment and will be classed in 3 rungs.

Rung A - max 5 years custody
Performing mental torture or depraved acts for a sadistic cause.

Rung B - max 2 years custody
Harming someone's mental or physical health in order to gain pleasure.

Rung C - max 6 months custody
Getting pleasure from the reaction or suffering of a person who has been mentally or physically harmed.

attributes.action: Remove VAT from home insulation and damp proofing products.
attributes.background:
Home insulation, damp proofing and draught exclusion are the top three most effective and simple means of reducing energy cost and emissions whilst improving environmental health.
Charging VAT on insulation, damp proofing and draught exclusion is hobbling those who do most to help the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The laws of physics and the governments own agencies agree with the priorities for energy efficiency and reduction of environmental cost/ damage.
Removal of VAT would be the single, simplest and most effective action whilst avoiding the high administration cost of the more complex and corruptible schemes.

attributes.action: Ban the use of sequential lighting indicators on cars; they are dangerously slow
attributes.background: Sequential lighting indicators use LEDs which expand over time to show the change of direction, these take a long time and can be distracting for other drivers.

attributes.action: Abolish all customs tariffs against developing countries after Brexit.
attributes.background: Please ensure that developing countries do not face the cold shoulder of protectionism so that they are able to trade fairly and freely with us, please do this by unilaterally abolishing customs tariffs against them.

attributes.action: Ban Cryptocurrency
attributes.background: Cryptocurrency such as Bitcoin is a payment method that is used in Dark Web to make make payments for criminal transactions such as fake notes, passports and even drugs. This need to be banned to clean up our society so that no criminal activity using this payment method takes place in the UK.

attributes.action: Scrap the government’s plan of building HS2 and build a Hyperloop system instead
attributes.background: Instead of spending billions of pounds of taxpayer’s money on a system that will take so long to complete that it will already be antiquated, the government should invest in a Hyperloop system, reducing journey times exponentially, with speeds of up to 700mph. Manchester to London in 18 minutes!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/2017/08/26/britains-hyperloop-pipe-dream-meet-people-behind-uks-futuristic/

http://www.independent.co.uk/travel/news-and-advice/hyperloop-one-richard-branson-virgin-investment-london-scotland-transport-travel-fast-a7998106.html

https://hyperloop-one.com

attributes.action: suspend work on smart motorways & use the money to repair the carriageways
attributes.background: Millions of pounds are being spent on smart motorway upgrades, yet a lot of the road surfaces are in a very poor condition. There are  potholes & sunken lanes everywhere. I propose that the money allocated to smart motorways should be used to bring the road surfaces up to a standard fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Changing the legal age for vaping WITHOUT nicotine from 18 to 16.
attributes.background: By lowering the age from 18 to 16 will allow young people who smoke to turn to a safer alternative. This will lower the lung cancer rate in young people. Save lives and lower the vaping age.

attributes.action: Build a Channel bridge between UK & France, to increase trade as we leave the EU
attributes.background: Build a Channel bridge between Britain and France to vastly increase trade between not just these two countries, but the entirety of Europe also. During uncertain times as we leave the European Union, such a project would reassure voters with increased economic confidence for the future.
attributes.additional_details: Would allow for easier access into both countries, making trade between UK and Europe much more easier.

attributes.action: Enlarge the area eligible for high cost area supplements for NHS staff
attributes.background:
The cost of living in South East England in areas such as Brighton and Hove is now on par with London. 

NHS staff in these areas are struggling to meet the basic costs of living such as rent, food and travel. We propose extending the fringe area eligible for high cost area supplement to Sussex.

attributes.action: Scrap English language (IELTs) test for spouse visa
attributes.background: UK has introduced English language test (Ielts), for the family members of British citizens without which its imposible to join them in the uk. I am personally affected by this as I have two kids under the age of 3 and I can’t bring them to the uk because their mum is unable to speak English.
attributes.additional_details: I hope this law is changed which will make it possible for thousands of families around the uk to be united with Their loved ones.I think it’s unfair for a war-torn country like Afghanistan which has been and is in war since 1978, how can the uk government expect such uneducated population to read and write their own language let alone speak English.

attributes.action: Create a new criminal offence. Use of a vehicle to threaten or intimidate.
attributes.background: More and more often people use their vehicle as a weapon toward other, more vulnerable road users. That could be a car driver toward a cyclist or pedestrian, or indeed a cyclist toward a pedestrian. The intentional close pass and other bullying is something that simply cannot be accepted on the road

attributes.action: Hold a Royal Commission on the future funding of the NHS and Adult Social Care
attributes.background: With the merging of the NHS and Adult Social Care briefs, now is the time to hold a Royal Commission on the future direction of a funding model for the NHS and Adult Social Care.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS and Adult Social Care briefs have recently been merged.
With ever increasing pressure on our NHS and Adult Social Care budgets, now is the time to look at a long term solution for funding, training and investment in the long-term future direction of the NHS and Adult Social Care. 
A Royal Commission should be established with a medical professional chairing it to take opinions from professionals and experts on how to take the NHS and Adult Social Care forward.

attributes.action: Change legislation around air pollution caused by fireworks, to improve health.
attributes.background: It’s the beginning of a new year and in many countries around the world, it has become a tradition to set off thousands of fireworks in elaborate displays. But if we stopped to consider the environmental impact of such extravagance, would we still choose this option or go for a safer, greener option
attributes.additional_details: Firework smoke has been shown to significantly increase breathing problems and have increased toxicity compared to traffic pollution. In this technologically advanced world we live in, surely we have the ability to come up with more inventive ways of using music, lights, and water displays to commemorate the new year.  In 2018, authorities in Dubai opted to light up the Burj Khalifa in a sensational display without fireworks, proving it can be done. We could save millions & our health-pls sign.

attributes.action: Parliament to set aside time to debate the rules whereby MPs put forward bills
attributes.background: Following the wrecking of two bills which had received extensive scrutiny by departments, and were supported by ministers, by a single MP calling "object" on a Friday afternoon, time should be set aside by Parliament to consider and amend the rules whereby MPs can introduce bills to the House.
attributes.additional_details: A single MP is currently able to wreck private members' bills by talking them out, or objecting.

attributes.action: Provide statutory youth services and programs.
attributes.background: There is currently no statutory obligation on local authorities to provide Youth Service Programs in respective Councils across the UK. Recently, this has meant that councils, when faced with Government austerity cuts, have had to slash services to young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to these drastic measures, many Youth Centres in the hearts of our communities have already faced forced closure and hundreds of thousands of young people now face a much-reduced range of services, support, guidance and now lack access to opportunities to acquire critical life skills. 

According to research on the government website london.gov.uk, between 2011 and 2017, at least £39 million has been slashed from council youth service budgets across London. Across 25 councils with similar data, 81 youth centres and major council-supported projects have been cut, and about 800 youth service posts are gone. 

A statutory youth program would mean that the government would proper scrutinize where the money they invest in youth channelled programs would be spent well.

attributes.action: Fine people who call 999 or show up to A&E without life threatening problems.
attributes.background: One in three calls are emergency and life threatening injuries. Two out of three are not. We can prevent wasting £8.50 on those who call 999 or show up to A&E wasting the healthcare’s time when they have other services they can utilise. Fining a person can help to deter these time wasting problems.
attributes.additional_details: 1. https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/society/2015/dec/25/frequent-999-callers-nhs-england-ambulance-emergency

attributes.action: Public enquiry into new 2018 train timetables' severe delays and cancellations
attributes.background: Since the introduction of new train timetables in May 2018, services by multiple train opertators have been serverely affected daily delays and cancellations. Poor forward planning by operators has caused unacceptable inconvenience, loss of earnings and damage to regional and national economies.

attributes.action: Allow the NHS to accept financial donations at a national level
attributes.background: There's one thing everyone agrees on in the UK, everyone values the NHS. The incredible impact from NHS staff is felt by family and friends near and far. Yet while the Government discusses blanket tax rises, they fail to recognise the easiest route to raising cash, through voluntary donations.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, it is possible to donate to small pockets of the NHS, mainly NHS Trusts, however, this doesn't go far enough and it's pretty hard to access. 

In 2017, the RNLI raised £196m (this figure grows year on year) through fundraising, imagine if the NHS created a central pot to accept donations.

attributes.action: Increase funding for research into pancreatic cancer
attributes.background: Pancreatic cancer is one of the hardest to catch, even if caught eairly enough still over 90% of patients die within a year. I want to ensure that more research money is allocated to help find better treatment as well as diognoses to ensure more people have a better chance of survival -1% at the min
attributes.additional_details: See pancreatic cancer charity for more information

attributes.action: A fresh look at Hi-tech solutions to reduce traffic congestion nationwide.
attributes.background:
Using roads sensibly will save most people money and will help save lives; according to the BBC article 1 in 6 deaths worldwide are due to pollution. 
We want the government to look at solutions available today that can dramatically reduce congestion, such as a smart phone app for car sharing.
attributes.additional_details:
Using a Car share app on a phone provides high levels of safety and an alternate lift home if necessary. 

The government is obliged to improve air quality.  http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-38990192
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-41678533

Using DfT report from 2005, an example an average car travelling 20 miles each day with 3 occupants, will save £1,000 per occupant per year.  
http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/+/http:/www.dft.gov.uk/pgr/sustainable/cars/makingcarsharingmarch2005.pdf

attributes.action: Protect house purchasers/vendors with a defined process/law & financial penalty
attributes.background:
A few years ago I ‘sold’ my property 4 times but only the 5th sale completed.

A property purchase/sale is the single biggest transaction but  there is no law to protect buyer or seller, the industry relies on morales.
attributes.additional_details:
Purchasers need to be given a cooling off period and then after this there should be defined criteria or extenuating circumstances for pulling out. 

Vendors should not be allowed to pull out of a sale except for extenuating circumstances. 

There should be a financial commitment prior to exchange which reimburses loses.

attributes.action: Free NHS prescriptions to families of Veterans who receive War Pensions AFCS
attributes.background: Veterans who have been awarded compensation for injuries sustained whilst serving this country are having to pay for NHS prescriptions due to their income being over the benefit rate.There is an employability supplement that equates to the ESA payment yet without the benefits of free healthcare.

attributes.action: Expand the Ancestry Visa to Commonwealth Citizens w/ UK born great grandparents
attributes.background: Currently, the Home Office only allows for Commonwealth Citizens who have at least one UK born grandparent to obtain an ancestry visa. We want to change this and extend this visa to Commonwealth Citizens who have at least one UK born great-grandparent.
attributes.additional_details: Many of us have cousins spread across the Commonwealth who still maintain close family connections with us despite the fact that they have been out of the UK for a few generations. If they wish to return to our island, then we should allow them to do so. In addition most of them have a great understanding of our political system and culture, as well conform to our standards. An act such as this will put us in a better position with the Commonwealth and help fill the Brexit labour shortage.

attributes.action: Revamp the House of Lords to only 400 members all of whom are Life Peers.
attributes.background: The House of Lords has become far too large for its purpose.
attributes.additional_details: Only the Chinese government has a bigger second chamber than the UK - which is absurd. The House of Lords no longer represents its national needs.

attributes.action: Give a bursary to those people wanting to train to teach drama
attributes.background: “Acting is behaving truthfully under imaginary circumstances.” - Sanford Meisner. Drama is a subject where students are creative, present in the moment and help them to understand their existence, both physically and emotionally. Teacher training is funded for several other subjects - why not drama?

attributes.action: Change the gcse scheme back to A,B,C instead of grades 9-1 so it’s easier
attributes.background: The students currently about to take GCSEs have been studying from year 7 up to get an A+ or etc all of a sudden the mark scheme has been changed which is not fair. The government have made it too hard for them to achieve in such small time.
attributes.additional_details: We need to make it easier so more students are able to be more successful in life. Changing the grading scheme has not made it only harder for children to be more successful but has also put more stress on them as the government had only changed it recently.

attributes.action: Extend the remit of Employment Tribunals to include all equality-related cases
attributes.background: Employment Tribunals should become Employment & Equality Tribunals and hear all equality-related cases. Why have an Equality Act if only employees have access to legal redress? The Government must ensure that everyone, including pensioners and students, has equal access to justice at equal cost.
attributes.additional_details: The additional burden on the tribunal system would be small compared with the huge difference the change would make to those suffering breaches of the law. If the government won't extend the remit, they must explain why disabled students have fewer rights than disabled employees. An employee with a discrimination claim can go to the tribunal, but if someone other than their employer discriminates against them, they have to file an expensive claim in the County Court or the High Court.

attributes.action: Make basic equality training a legal requirement for businesses
attributes.background: The equality act 2010 is a wonderful piece of legislation that protects people from discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: If you've ever been treated unfairly due to your disability, age, race or gender, it is there to protect you but what happens when someone or a company does it and refuses to change? Nothing a lot of the time and it's not right! People and companies need to be educated on the equality act and make reasonable adjustments where necessary.

attributes.action: No military action in Syria until perpetrators of chemical attacks are verified.
attributes.background: Involvement in missile strikes or other military action against the Syrian government will escalate the conflict, resulting in yet greater loss of life. Please hold back until we know more.

attributes.action: Legally require the Net Internal Floor area to be quoted for every home on sale.
attributes.background: Homes in Britain are traded in terms of rooms rather than floor space. This lack of clear information is a source of market failure. British homes are getting more cramped and less fit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details: There are no minimum space standards for new housing in Britain. Research by CABE and LABC Warranty shows that developers are making homes smaller and smaller. New homes lack space for family meals, for childrens play and homework, and for storage. Quoting the Net Internal Floor area (e.g. as defined by the Valuation Office Agency) would help buyers understand exactly what they are getting, make objective comparisons, and identify value for money.

attributes.action: Make the Department for Education invest £1.3 billion pounds in schools
attributes.background:
I am a student and the reason why I started this petition is because the education budget cuts had a devastating effect on my school and other schools in London.

If you sign this petition you are supporting my plea to make the government invest £1.3 billion pounds in schools.
attributes.additional_details: If you sign this petition you are supporting my plea to make the government to invest £1.3billion pounds in schools

attributes.action: Write all laws in Plain English
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that in order for the majority of the people to fully participate in the governance of the country, our laws should be written in a language that the people can readily understand.
attributes.additional_details:
We further believe that the current practice of drafting and presenting laws in Legal English and “Legalese” is detrimental to a truly representative Parliament and the involvement of the people in the government of the country.

We therefore demand that all future laws made in the UK Parliament should be written in Plain English.

attributes.action: Add Lichen sclerosus to the Medical Exemption list
attributes.background: To obtain a Medical Exemption Certificate and get free NHS prescriptions a condition needs to be on the current Medical Exemption list. I feel this list does not go far enough to help those suffering with long-term conditions such as Lichen Sclerosus. A revision could help thousands of people.

attributes.action: Cancel HS2 and use the allocated funds to help find a cure for cancer.
attributes.background: The debate on the long term benefits of HS2 and the use of an estimated £56bn of public funds on such a project have been going on for sometime. If the British public actually had a vote, would it be in favour of spending £56bn on HS2 or helping find a cure for cancer !
attributes.additional_details:
My mother has been battling with cancer for the last few years with the aid of vital treatments however a cure still doesn't exist and sadly  she has now been given months if not weeks to live as she is no longer responding to treatment.

A close family friend who stands to lose everything he's worked for much like countless others due to the HS2 project made a point that perhaps the funds could be better spent on something that could truly benefit each and everyone for generation to come.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for motorbikes to have different coloured headlamps to cars
attributes.background: Driving at night, in heavy traffic or in wet weather it is often difficult to differentiate a motorbike weaving down between lanes from other cars.  If motorbikes had a different coloured headlamp (yellow maybe), drivers, incl. other riders, looking in rear/side view mirrors would better spot them.
attributes.additional_details: I think this would significantly improve road safety by reducing the number of car accidents with motorbikes when they are not seen by drivers joining / changing lanes in heavy traffic.  The headlight colour would obviously need to be one that would afford the bike rider equal visibility.

attributes.action: Ban the production and sale of non-recycled toilet paper in this country.
attributes.background: All of us use toilet paper every day.  Has it ever occurred to you that most toilet paper is made from new trees?  Recycled toilet paper is not widely available in shops in this country.  It should be the only option available because of the huge negative impact it has on the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some facts (http://www.theworldcounts.com/counters/how_consumerism_affects_the_environment/toilet_paper_environmental_impact):

- The toilet paper we use could go around the planet every 2 minutes, or travel to the sun and back every 10 days.

- The difference between using new toilet paper and toilet paper made from recycled materials is 400 million trees, 660 million tons of water, and 45 million tons of oil.

attributes.action: Working people should be awarded 100% of the non working partners tax allowance
attributes.background: Every UK citizen is intitled to tax free income of 11500 pa. The fact that in a family unit only one person may be in full time employment while the other person may be at home bringing up children is not a good reason to financially penalise that family or any other in a similar position.

attributes.action: Introduce LGBT+ education to the primary curriculum in schools
attributes.background:
One of the reasons homophobia is still widespread is due to lack of education and understanding. To reverse this, and create a more accepting and less hating society for the future I want to petition for children to be educated.
Just as racism, sexism and other issues ARE issues, this is a HUGE one
attributes.additional_details:
Homophobia - the act of hatred from minor to extreme levels towards people who prefer the same gender
Impacts -
more hate crimes, tragedies, killings and more, just for something someone cant change and which is not abnormal, a "sin" or any other sort
Evidence -
You dont need me to state. Recall some memories when you were a child.Look at the messed up world.Look at the different LGBT rights in areas. Not many places have equal rights yet at ALL.
Speak up and SIGN this petition for EQUALITY

attributes.action: Abolish school uniform in all schools.
attributes.background: School uniform rules have recently become too strict, to the point where people are being suspended from school for their appearance. We preach about not missing education yet we stop it over cloth and dye? Teenagers should express themselves and not be punished for being unique.
attributes.additional_details: When a student has done something particularly bad like get into a fight or bully another student we suspend them or put them in isolation to punish the student. Why is a student with blue hair or with a t-shirt being punished at the same level? We encourage students to 'be themselves' yet we confine this with rules. Teenagers already struggle in schools with exams, hormones, sexuality etc. We shouldn't be giving them more reasons to stress out. Casual dress-code doesn't stop them learning.

attributes.action: Conduct rolling referenda so that the Brexit deal commands support AT THE TIME
attributes.background: Older voters, who were more likely to have died by the time 'Leave' takes effect, tended to favour 'Leave', whilst those under the age of 18, who will live much longer with the consequences, didn't get a vote at all.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposal is to conduct a potentially rolling sequence of referenda to ensure that the final outcome from the Brexit negotiations reflects the widest possible support AT THE TIME THE FINAL DEAL COMES INTO EFFECT.

There are 4 options. 1. Take the deal. 2. Re-negotiate 3. Stay in the EU 4. Leave with no agreement.

The voters rank the options in order of preference.

When one option commands more than 50 percent of the votes, or if the top option is 2, re-negotiate, that's what HMG will action.

Otherwise the option with the fewest votes is eliminated, and its supporters' votes are re-allocated to their next preferences.

If option 2, re-negotiate, wins, there would have to be a further referendum 3 months later, conducted as above.

attributes.action: Increase the driving age to 21
attributes.background: I believe that being able to drive at 17 is far too young and the age limit should be increased to 21 to try and save lives

attributes.action: Make A levels 3 years. This is to avoid psychological stress for young people.
attributes.background: Governments should take initiative to create this legislation as it would decrease psychological stress for young people.The psychological health of the youth is worrying with many dropping out and wanting to end their lives. We need to support the youth to create a more skilled workforce.
attributes.additional_details:
Today several aspects of young people’s quality of life and lack of well-being in this latest update has increased with over 42 .2% of 16-
19 year old experiencing anxiety which in many cases relates to education. 231 people committed suicide in 2017 due to exam stress while many other attempted to take their own life. We need to help our youth as these are the people of tomorrow. All life is precious so it must be safeguarded by us the people.

attributes.action: All EU powers should return to Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland after Brexit
attributes.background: The UK government is saying that they need to reserve some powers after Brexit to protect the UK single market.  But that’s not necessarily true.  What they’re proposing would actually damage the UK and the UK single market.  So I call on the UK to automatically devolve all of these EU powers.
attributes.additional_details: Devolving all these powers would might prevent the break up of the UK.  Whereas, what the UK government is proposing would actually break Britain up.  So I would like to see a cross-party discussion on this.
